attributes.comment:
As an adoptive parent currently in process, I would like to express my utmost
disapproval for the proposed increases in USCIS fees, particularly as they
relate to the adoption of a child from another country. I am recommending that
the fees be held at the current rates, as many families must file twice because
the approval to adopt is only valid for 18 months and the USCIS does not permit
renewal at a reduced rate. This means families must pay full price twice.

Here is what it currently costs to file with USCIS for a couple just to adopt:

What it used to be when adoptions took place within 18 months:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140

Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:

I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320

Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 or over 140%! That's how much more USCIS will be
charging me, as well as other adoptive parents, with no increase in services.

Furthermore, the calculation above is not taking into consideration the fact
that applying for my child's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) will go
from $215 to $460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase. Perhaps if I
could expect speedy service, this increase might be justified, however in many
cases the certificate is not received for a year after filing.

International adoption is a financially draining process for the average
American, with current expenses ranging from $25,000 to $40,000. By increasing
the USCIS fees, you are further limiting the ability of many Americans to make
their family through the adoption process. Please reconsider the fee increase
proposal as it relates to adoption fees and hold the current rates.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Stephanie Legrand
